void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::addKey ( Key &  key)

addKey: Add a key to THIS Curve

Parameters:
[in]key/ Key to be added
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::eulerFilter ( void  )

eulerFilter: Assuming THIS curve represents euler angles this function process THIS entire Curve searching and fixing for angle discontinuities, i.e. always taking the least angle difference between the last and the current key

double nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::evaluate ( double  time)

evaluate: Evaluate THIS curve at specific time.

Parameters:
[in]time/ Time, in seconds
Returns:
Value of THIS Curve at the specific time

getExpression: Get the curve's expression string

Returns:
THIS Curve's expression string
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::getKeys ( std::vector< Key > &  keys)

getKeys: Get THIS Curve's keys. Please note that the order of the returned keys is the order used at creation and not the order of keys in the time line.

Parameters:
[out]keys/ Curve's keys

bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::isSplineAndExpression ( void  )

isSplineAndExpression: Returns true if value for THIS Curveis the result of adding the expression and spline values.

Returns:
: true if adds spline and expression for evaluation
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::removeAllKeys ( void  )

removeAllKeys: Remove all keys from THIS Curve

void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::removeKey ( Key &  key)

removeKey: Remove a key from THIS Curve. The key passed as parameter has to be the key got from the list of keys returned by the addKey function. This means that we can't create a new key and set that key as the parameter to this function with the hope that the key at that time position is going to be removed

Parameters:
[in]key/ Key to be removed. Has to be part of the list of keys returned by the addKey function
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::setExpression ( std::string  exp)

setExpression: Set THIS curve's expression string

Parameters:
[in]exp/ Curve's expression string
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::setPostBehaviour ( int  postBehaviour)

setPostBehaviour: Set the curve's post-behaviour. Valid values are CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_ZERO, CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_CONSTANT, CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_LOOP, CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_LOOPOFFSET and CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_FOLLOWTANGENT.

Parameters:
[in]postBehaviour/ Curve's post-behaviour
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::setPreBehaviour ( int  preBehaviour)

setPreBehaviour: Set THIS Curve's pre-behaviour. Valid values are CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_ZERO and CURVE_BEHAVIOUR_CONSTANT.

Parameters:
[in]preBehaviour/ Curve's pre-behaviour
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::Curve::setSplineAndExpression ( const bool &  enable)

setSplineAndExpression: Set the value of the curve to be evaluated by adding expression and spline values.

Parameters:
[in]enable/ True for adding expression and spline value. False for using expression if exists. Otherwise spline is used.
